channel.title: A Problem

item.title: A Problem
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:6, topic:486615”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=604851.msg4225275#msg4225275 date=1360979471]
I’m gonna throw it in that if you insist on using procedural code at least use mysqli rather than mysql. Why would someone use the deprecated version when there’s something newer and better :rolleyes:
[/quote]

Because I know nothing about it and I would rather get going on MySQL and then eventually switch over.[/quote]
I don’t understand that one bit, don’t learn the deprecated code. Learn the new way before you start mixing them. If you’re using procedural you can get away with changing the simple mysql_ to mysqli_ in a lot of cases, not sure if it’s all cases but certainly most.

Read full topic

item.title: A Problem
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:3, topic:486615”]Like so?

$res = mysql_query($sql); [/quote]

Yes, and using $res to check for the query’s success or for any errors.

Read full topic

Like so?

$res = mysql_query($sql);

Read full topic

item.title: A Problem
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

I’m assuming it’s supposed to query the database? If so, you’ve just created a query string instead of doing such and querying. Call mysql_query() to do that.

PS: You’ve already sanitized the username and passwords so no need to do it in the query string. Rewrite the query cause it’s wrong (syntactically as well).

Read full topic

item.title: A Problem
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Yes, I know the code is nooby and insecure. Why doesn’t it work? What am I doing wrong?


<?php

	require 'config.php';
	session_start();

	$username = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['username']);
	$password1 = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['password1']);
	$password2 = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['password2']);
	$email = mysql_real_escape_string($_POST['email']);
	
	$password1 = md5($password1);
	
	if(isset($_POST['regBtn'])) {

		if($password1 == $password2) {
			$sql="INSERT INTO users (username, password, email) VALUES ('mysql_real_escape_string($username)','mysql_real_escape_string($password1)','mysql_real_escape_string($email')";
		}
	}
?>

Read full topic
